metadata.name: Planet of Motherhood
metadata.description:
Planet_of_Motherhood

This artwork symbolically represents children and the Earth as things that women protect. The sculpture of a woman and a glass sphere, which is placed in water, represents water as a metaphor for the voices of society and external attacks. The artwork questions the coexistence of nature,society and  women.  
The fact that the sphere covers half of the woman's body represents how women both protect and are restrained by what they are defending, as well as their connection to the earth. It carries a message that what women protect is connected to themselves, and they need to cherish it.  
The artwork expresses the courage and strength necessary for women to protect the earth, children, and themselves, and reminds us of it. It also shows that women sometimes sacrifice themselves in order to live in harmony with nature.This artwork aims to encourage us to think about our responsibilities.
